verses.name: Acts 23:23
verses.text: And he called unto him two centurions, saying, Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Cesarea, and horsemen threescore and ten, and spearmen two hundred, at the third hour of the night;

verses.name: Acts 23:24
verses.text: And provide them beasts, that they may set Paul on, and bring him safe unto Felix the governor.

verses.name: Acts 23:25
verses.text: And he wrote a letter after this manner:

verses.name: Acts 23:26
verses.text: Claudius Lysias unto the most excellent governor Felix sendeth greeting.

verses.name: Acts 23:27
verses.text: This man was taken of the Jews, and should have been killed of them: then came I with an army, and rescued him, having understood that he was a Roman.
